title: Index vs Active Funds
insight: Index funds often outperform active funds over time.
explanation: While active funds aim to beat the market through stock picking, they often incur higher fees and underperform benchmarks, especially after costs.
example: In the last decade, the S&P 500 index fund returned around 14% annually while many actively managed funds returned less than 8%.
action: Try this: Invest in a low-cost index fund instead of high-fee active funds.
